titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1219
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1219

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

div.tei:ab: 1.[... ...](m)rṯdm | yʿrr | [hqnyw | šym-hmw | tʾlb | rymm | bʿl] 2.rḥ[bn | ṣlmn | b-ḏt | ʾtww | ʾdm]-hw | bnw | ḏ-rg[z |] (b)n | m[... ...] 3.(š)ddm [| ... ... |] (w-yḥṯ)t | ʾrśl | (w-g)rmʿṯ[t | ... ...tq=] 4.dm | ḍrm | b-ʿ(m) [| ʾmrʾ-hm]w | ʾmlk | sbʾ | w-b-[ḏt] | ṣdq [| w-hwfyn | tʾlb | rymm | ʾdm-h=] 5.w | bny | ḏ-rgz | b-kl | ʾmlʾ | stmlʾ[n | b]-ʿm-h[w | ʾdm-hw | bnw | ḏ-rgz | w-b-kl] 6.ʾmlʾ | yzʾnn | stmlʾn | b-ʿm-h<w> | ʾdm-hw | bn(w) [| ḏ-rgz | w-l | sʿd | tʾlb | ʾd=] 7.(m)-hw | bny | ḏ-rgz | nʿmtm | w-wfym | w-b(r)y | ʾʾ[ḏnm | w-ʾwldm | ʾḏkrm | h=] 8.nʾm | w-ʾṯmr | ṣdqm | bn | ʾrḍ-hmw [| w]-m[šym-hmw | w-rḍw | ʾmrʾ-hmw | bny | hmdn] 9.w-(š)ʿb-hmw | ḥšdm | b-tʾlb | rymm

1.[... ...] Marthadum Yaʿrir [have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of] 2.Raḥī[bān (this) statue because] his [servants] of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz [returned] from [... ...] 3.Shaddādum [... ...] and Yaḥthat ʾArśal and Garamʿatha[t | ... ... engag-=] 4.ed in warfare alongside [their lords,] the kings of Sabaʾ; and be[cause Taʾlab Riyāmum] maintained [and protected his servants] 5.of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz by means of all the favorable oracles which [his servants of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz had sought [f]rom h[im, and by means of all] 6.the favorable oracles that his servants of the lineage of [Dhū-Ragaz] might in future seek from him. [And may Taʾlab grant his ser-=] 7. of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz prosperity, and well-being, and soundness of [mind, and healthy male children,] 8.and good crops from their land [and their fields, and the good pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān] 9.and their tribe of Ḥāshidum. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

div.tei:ab:
Marthadum Yaʿrir have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of
Raḥībān this statue because his servants of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz returned from
Shaddādum and Yaḥthat ʾArśal and Garamʿathat engag-=
ed in warfare alongside their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ; and because Taʾlab Riyāmum maintained and protected his servants
of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz by means of all the favorable oracles which his servants of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz had sought from him, and by means of all
the favorable oracles that his servants of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz might in future seek from him. And may Taʾlab grant his ser-=
of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz prosperity, and well-being, and soundness of mind, and healthy male children,
and good crops from their land and their fields, and the good pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān
and their tribe of Ḥāshidum. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.

Marthadum Yaʿrir have dedicated to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, lord of
Raḥībān this statue because his servants of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz returned from
Shaddādum and Yaḥthat ʾArśal and Garamʿathat engag-=
ed in warfare alongside their lords, the kings of Sabaʾ; and because Taʾlab Riyāmum maintained and protected his servants
of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz by means of all the favorable oracles which his servants of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz had sought from him, and by means of all
the favorable oracles that his servants of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz might in future seek from him. And may Taʾlab grant his ser-=
of the lineage of Dhū-Ragaz prosperity, and well-being, and soundness of mind, and healthy male children,
and good crops from their land and their fields, and the good pleasure of their lords of the lineage of Hamdān
and their tribe of Ḥāshidum. By Taʾlab Riyāmum.
